item.description: == Recursive list ls -R ls -l -R Using find command find . -print find . -ls Using du command du -a . du -a /path/to/search/ | more == Copy without hidden folder rsync -a --exclude='.*' /source/ /destination === Prevent deleting destination files that match a pattern rsync -avrc --delete --exclude somedir source destination rsync ... --filter 'protect /remote-directory-to-keep/' ... rsync ... --filter='P my-specific-logfile.log' exclude all log files from being transferred from the source to destination, and delete all existing ones on the destination.

== Ask for user input in bash [source,json] while true; do read -p “Do you wish to continue running this?” inp case $inp in [Yy]* ) break;; [Nn]* ) exit;; * ) echo “Please answer yes or no”;; esac done echo “Do you wish to install this program?” select yn in “Yes” “No”; do case $yn in Yes ) make install; break;; No ) exit;; esac done echo -n “Is this a good question (y/n)?

item.title: scp
item.description: Secure copy protocol(SCP) allows files to be copied between machines/servers in a secure way. Usage scp <source-specification> <destination-specification> Tip Format for a resource in remote(source or destination) is: user@machine:filename Format for file specification on local system is : filename While accessing a remote server make sure user account exists in remote destination make sure filesystem has sufficient permission to be accessed by user account
